metadata.title: CVE-2016-1637 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The SkATan2_255 function in effects/gradients/SkSweepGradient.cpp in Skia,as used in Google Chrome before 49.0.2623.75, mishandles arctangentcalculations, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive informationvia a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-browser-l10n - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-chromedriver - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.13.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.13.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.13.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.13.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.13.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.13.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.13.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
